intro: Hieracium gigantium var. setulosum, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears yellow composite flowers. The leaves are characterized by their rough, hairy texture, which gives the plant its common name. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads and medicinal properties in some species.
